annotations.description: The game wasn't exhilarating, but it wasn't totally boring either. There were a few nice moments from both sides. The game was controlled by the home side. The home team made a lot of passes and attempted to maintain possession, while the away side made defence their highest priority.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) makes contact with a cross and strikes a shot that lacks the power to find the back of the net, but the goalkeeper still has to make a good save to keep his effort out. The referee signals a corner kick to Bayern Munich.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a beautiful cross from the side, but the opposition defence is ready and one of the defenders averts the threat with a quick interception. The ball goes out of play and FC Augsburg will have a goal kick.

annotations.description: Total attempts – 27:4.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 1:1.
Marwin Hitz pulls off a great save to deny Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Dong Won Ji (Augsburg) will replace Raul Bobadilla.

Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) latches on to a precise pass and one on one with the keeper slams the ball towards the right hand post. Marwin Hitz is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Bayern Munich seem to be finding their feet as they enjoy some possession. They are waiting for the right moment to create new attacking opportunities.

annotations.label: substitution

Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) tries his luck with a shot from long distance after receiving a good pass. He hits the ball poorly and sends it into orbit.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) wins himself enough space to meet the resulting corner and fires the ball at goal, but the keeper does well to stop his effort.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) will take a corner kick.
Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) whips the ball in, but it fails to reach any of his teammates as the opposition's defence averts the threat. Now Bayern Munich have a corner.

Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the middle of the target, but Marwin Hitz was alert and the score remains the same.
David Alaba (Bayern Munich) smashes the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but it fails to bother the goalkeeper as it hits the defensive wall.

Jan Ingwer Callsen Bracker (Augsburg) was too fierce in his attempt to get the ball from his opponent and Knut Kircher blows for a foul. Bayern Munich win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) produces an attempt from the edge of the box which would have most likely endangered the goalkeeper, but one of the defending players blocked it, so we can only speculate about the outcome.
Xabi Alonso (Bayern Munich) unleashes a mid range direct free kick, but sees his strike well saved by the goalkeeper.

was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Knut Kircher blows his whistle for an infringement. Another situation results in a direct free kick for Bayern Munich.
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) latches onto a lofted pass on the edge of the penalty box and unleashes a volley towards goal, but it goes high over the crossbar.
Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him.
Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) chips a pass over the line of defenders to get the ball to Robert Lewandowski, but his attempt is intercepted and cleared.
Wonderful pass from Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) for Philipp Lahm, but they can't profit from it as Marwin Hitz comes off his line to collect.
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) is moving okay again after that injury scare.

annotations.label: injury
annotations.description: Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) is having a really tough time right now. We are about to find out how serious his injury is.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Marwin Hitz.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: Referee Knut Kircher blows his whistle to start the second half.

We can hope that the managers will be able to motivate the players and stir them to improve their performance for after the half time break. We haven't seen really exciting football in the previous 45 minutes. Bayern Munich dominated the opening period and easily created the most chances. The tactic of the home side is slow build up play, while the away team's main priority is a flawless defence.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
A cross is whipped into the box by Douglas Costa (Bayern Munich) and Philipp Lahm controls it well. He lines up the ball, but one of the defenders produces a timely intervention.

annotations.label: soccer-ball

What a save from Marwin Hitz! Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
